newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa's JSE trading system hits fault.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa's JSE trading system hits fault.

text.p: The JET trading system of South Africa's Johannesburg Stock Exchange (JSE) has hit a fault and stopped working, dealers said.
They said the system ceased trading at about 0900 GMT. "It went down about half an hour ago," one dealer said.
The JSE could not immediately be reached for comment.
The all-share index was last at 6,958.8, down 136.0 points, and the industrials index was off 169.4 points to 8,170.0. The golds index was off 10.7 points to 1,290.9.
